api_key.description: API key for calculating request signatures for Tetration API calls.

api_secret.description: API secret for calculating request signatures for Tetration API calls.

disable_tls_verification.description: Allow connections to Tetration endpoints without validating their TLS certificate.

alternate_query_mode.description: (Optional) Indicates if “dynamic mode” is used for the application. In dynamic mode, an ADM run creates one or more candidate queries for each cluster. Default value is true.

app_scope_id.description: ID of the scope assigned to the application.

author.description: First and last name of the user who created the application.

created_at.description: Unix timestamp indicating when the application was created.

enforced_version.description: The enforced p* version of the application.

enforcement_enabled.description: Indicates if enforcement is enabled on the application.

latest_adm_version.description: The latest adm (v*) version of the application.

primary.description: (Optional) Set to true to indicate this application is primary for the given scope. Default value is true.

strict_validation.description: (Optional) Return an error if there are unknown keys/attributes in the uploaded data. Useful for catching misspelled keys. Default value is false.

consumer_filter_id.description: ID of a cluster, user inventory filter, or application scope.

consumer_filter_name.description: Named filter. If more than one filter with the same name exists you must specify consumer_filter_id. Only one of consumer_filter_id, consumer_filter_name or consumer_scope_name can be specified.

consumer_scope_name.description: Named application scope. If more than one application scope with the same name exists you must specify consumer_filter_id. Only one of consumer_filter_id, consumer_filter_name or consumer_scope_name can be specified.

provider_filter_id.description: ID of a cluster, user inventory filter, or application scope.

provider_filter_name.description: Named filter. If more than one filter with the same name exists you must specify consumer_filter_id. Only one of consumer_filter_id, consumer_filter_name or consumer_scope_name can be specified.

provider_scope_name.description: Named application scope. If more than one application scope with the same name exists you must specify consumer_filter_id. Only one of consumer_filter_id, consumer_filter_name or consumer_scope_name can be specified.

approved.description: (Optional) Indicates whether the policy is approved. Default is false.

port_range.description: Inclusive range of ports; for example, [80, 80] or [5000, 6000].

protocol.description: Protocol integer value (NULL means all protocols).

consistent_uuid.description: Must be unique to a given application. After an ADM run, the similar/same clusters in the next version will maintain the consistent_uuid.

id.description: Unique identifier to be used with policies.

ip_address.description: IP address or subnet of the node; for example, 10.0.0.1/8 or 1.2.3.4.

consumer_filter_id.description: ID of a cluster, user inventory filter, or application scope.

consumer_filter_name.description: Named filter. If more than one filter with the same name exists you must specify consumer_filter_id. Only one of consumer_filter_id, consumer_filter_name or consumer_scope_name can be specified.

consumer_scope_name.description: Named application scope. If more than one application scope with the same name exists you must specify consumer_filter_id. Only one of consumer_filter_id, consumer_filter_name or consumer_scope_name can be specified.

provider_filter_id.description: ID of a cluster, user inventory filter, or application scope.

provider_filter_name.description: Named filter. If more than one filter with the same name exists you must specify consumer_filter_id. Only one of consumer_filter_id, consumer_filter_name or consumer_scope_name can be specified.

provider_scope_name.description: Named application scope. If more than one application scope with the same name exists you must specify consumer_filter_id. Only one of consumer_filter_id, consumer_filter_name or consumer_scope_name can be specified.

approved.description: (Optional) Indicates whether the policy is approved. Default is false.

port_range.description: Inclusive range of ports; for example, [80, 80] or [5000, 6000].

protocol.description: Protocol integer value (NULL means all protocols).

id.description: Unique identifier to be used with policies.

query.description: JSON object representation of an inventory filter query.

app_scope_id.description: ID of the scope associated with the filter.

name.description: User-specified name for the inventory filter.

primary.description: (Optional) When true, the filter is restricted to the ownership scope.

public.description: (Optional) When true the filter provides a service for its scope. Must also be primary/scope restricted.

query.description: JSON object representation of an inventory filter query.

access_app_scope_id.description: The scope to which this role will be given access

access_type.description:
The type of access to grant the role to the `access_app_scope_id` scope.
 Valid values are [SCOPE_READ, SCOPE_WRITE, EXECUTE, ENFORCE, SCOPE_OWNER, DEVELOPER]

app_scope_id.description: The scope in which this role will be created

user_ids.description: The users to which this role will be assigned

child_app_scope_ids.description: Indicates a child or parent query has been updated and that the changes need to be committed..

created_at.description: Unix Epoch timestamp when scope was created.

dirty.description: Indicates a child or parent query has been updated and that the changes need to be committed..

name.description: Fully qualified name of the scope. This is a fully qualified name; that is, it includes the names of parent scopes (if applicable) all the way to the root scope.

parent_app_scope_id.description: What resource field to use when evaluating the scope query.

policy_priority.description: Used to sort application priorities; default is last.

root_app_scope_id.description: Root scope for the tetration installation

short_priority.description: Used to sort application priorities; default is last.

short_query_field.description: What resource field to use when evaluating the scope query.

short_query_value.description: What resource value to use when evaluating the scope query.

updated_at.description: Unix Epoch timestamp when scope was last updated.

vrf_id.description: ID of the VRF to which scope belongs.

attributes.description: Key/value map for tagging matching flows and inventory items.

app_scope_id.description: (Optional) Root scope to which the user belongs.

disabled_at.description: UNIX timestamp indicating when the user account was disabled. Zero or null if not disabled.

email.description: Email address associated with the user account.

enable_existing.description: If true, and an existing but disabled user with the same email exists they will be enabled.

role_ids.description: (Optional) A list of roles to be assigned to the user.
